# Write-MCDLog

Source: `source/Private/Core/Logging/Write-MCDLog.ps1`

## Synopsis

Writes a log entry to the MCD log file.

## Description

Writes a timestamped log line to a UTF-8 log file. If no explicit log path is
provided, the function uses the default MCD LogsRoot for the current runtime
context (WinPE vs full Windows).

## Parameters

| Name | Type | Mandatory | Pipeline | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Level | String | Yes | No | Log level used to tag the message in the log file and in verbose output. |
| Message | String | Yes | No | The message text to write as a single log line. |
| Path | String | No | No | Optional explicit path to the log file to write to. |

## Examples

### Example 1

```powershell
Write-MCDLog -Level Info -Message 'Workspace initialized.'

Writes an informational log entry to the default MCD log file.
```
